alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 01 at 7:36PM PST until January 04 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM TUESDAY TO 3 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet, with local sets to 18 feet, and dangerous rip currents. Highest surf on west and northwest facing beaches. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...From 9 PM Tuesday to 3 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minimal coastal flooding risk through Thursday. Another round of high surf will be likely late Friday into this weekend. With tide levels expected to increase to around 6 feet this weekend, there will be the potential for moderate advisory level coastal flooding near times of high tide.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
